gameplay.input.ai

Class SmartAI

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.input.ai.AI
      • gameplay.input.ai.SmartAI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommandIssuer, java.io.Serializable

    public class SmartAI
extends AI
    AI implementation of the High inteligence AI as per requirement "High intelligence enemies move like medium intelligence enemies with a 50% chance of changing directions. High intelligence enemies shall chase bomberman if he is within a 2 square radius; if there is an obstacle between bomberman and the enemy, it will use A star search to find the path to bomberman, if such a path exists. The enemy will check for bomberman and recalculate the path everytime it traverses 1 grid cell."
    Author:
    YA
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Command chdirAndChaseBomberman(java.lang.Boolean percentChance)
        This method encompasses the change direction method but it also makes the GameActor (enemy) an enemy
        Parameters:
        percentChance -
        Returns:
        up, down, right, left depending on what direction it was going before and depending on if bomberman is around

      • changeDirection

        public Command changeDirection(java.lang.Boolean percentChance)
        This method makes the GameActor change directions.
        Parameters:
        percentChance - the chance it changes directions per intersection
        Returns:
        up, down, right, left depending on the direction it was going before and the percentChance

      • upAndDown

        public Command upAndDown()
        This method returns up or down depending on whether the GameActor can go up or down
        Returns:

        public Command leftAndRight()
        This method makes an enemy move right or left
        Returns:

      • isFiftyPercent

        public java.lang.Boolean isFiftyPercent()
        This method is a randomizer, true 50% of the time, false 50% of the time
        Returns:
        returns true or false depending on the int received from Random.nextInt

      • isZeroOneTwoThreeFour

        public java.lang.Boolean isZeroOneTwoThreeFour(int integer)
        This method sees if a number is 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4
        Parameters:
        integer - integer obtained from a randomizer
        Returns:
        returns true if the number is indeed 0, 1, 2, 3 or 4
